headline: The Ukrainian-held Donbas, a land of ruins and grief
subhead: This region in eastern Ukraine now has only 200,000 inhabitants, compared to five million before the Russian invasion of 2022. Le Monde visited the area still under Kyiv's authority.

headline: Bob Weir, founding member of the Grateful Dead, has died at age 78
Trump signs emergency order to protect US-held revenue from Venezuela oil
Syria's Kurdish fighters agree to leave Aleppo after deadly clashes
subhead: The fighting, some of the most intense since the ousting of long-time ruler Bashar al-Assad in December 2024, has killed at least 21 civilians, according to figures from both sides, while Aleppo's governor said 155,000 people fled their homes. Both sides blamed the other for starting the clashes on Tuesday.

headline: When the damage caused by alcohol begins in utero
subhead: Drinking alcoholic beverages during pregnancy can trigger more or less severe neurodevelopmental and growth disorders. Recent studies also show that fathers' alcohol consumption prior to conception may play a harmful role as well.

headline: In Los Angeles, one year after the fires: 'I will only live here if the neighborhood is rebuilt to withstand fire'
subhead: One year after massive wildfires devastated the southern coast of California, residents are laser-focused on rebuilding. But as they weigh the need for speed against the desire to build back better, they confront questions about the best way to preserve their quality of life.

headline: Christophe Vasseur, baker and restaurateur
subhead: The founder of the hugely popular Du Pain et des Idées bakery in central Paris just opened a welcoming eatery. There, he showcases his mastery of oven baking by offering communal cuisine where large 'mosaic pizzas' take center stage.

headline: Moses with a selfie stick, Goliath at a weightlifting competition: How AI gives the sacred new life
US announces 'large-scale' strikes against IS in Syria
Mexico's president downplays Trump's threats
Iran's bloody and concealed crackdown
Metric or imperial? Canada faces the everyday puzzle of weights and measures
Greenland's parties reject American rule after latest Trump threat
US oil majors show only moderate enthusiasm for Venezuelan oil, despite Trump's urging
Victor Hugo's lesser-known genius: Decoration
EU Commission considers enacting the EU-Mercosur trade deal before MEPs ratify it
Venezuela says in talks with US to restore diplomatic ties
Annika's conversion to Sufism: 'For years, I limited myself to practicing the whirling dervish dance, trying to convince myself that Islam did not interest me'
Laurent Vinatier's release: Putin makes a gesture amid frozen France-Russia relations
'Don't forget you saved my life': Letter to the stranger who gave me their bone marrow
subhead: Hélène Schlesinger was 37 and had a husband, two children, and plenty of plans for the future when she learned, in 2022, that she had leukemia. For months, the young woman fought as she waited for a bone marrow transplant. She lives thanks to an anonymous donor. All she knows is that he is German and that a part of him now lives inside her.

headline: 'In Iran, the conditions that enabled the American operation in Venezuela are not present'
subhead: Political analyst Hamzeh Safavi, whose father is an adviser to Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, discusses the abduction of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro by the US on January 3 in Caracas, and its impact on the Islamic Republic.

headline: 'Christopher Columbus embodying Trump and Meloni's supremacist fantasies is no coincidence'
subhead: 'Debated Figures' (1/5). Once praised by French traditionalist Catholics, the 'discoverer of America' is now celebrated by American and Italian leaders, writes historian Romain Bertrand.

headline: France's narrow path toward a budget
'Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland'
Greenland is and must remain European
